item.title: Final Fantasy 16 Cements a New Pattern For Xbox
item.description:
Summer Game Fest 2025 has come and gone, and Xbox made out with a solid showing for the rest of the year and 2026. Among the various surprises and returning games in the main portion of the Xbox Games Showcase, Square Enix dropped in with a couple of titles that many would argue are overdue for Xbox ports. Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade will be coming to Xbox Series consoles in Winter 2025, while Final Fantasy 16 was shadow-dropped on them after the show. Although this comes after these games have migrated to every other platform, it's still good to see Final Fantasy 16 and FF7R on Xbox.

Even if these announcements are comparable to Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade being announced for the Nintendo Switch 2 in Winter as well, there's special value in seeing Square Enix finally bring its biggest modern games onto Xbox platforms. It was a big deal back when Final Fantasy 13 came to Xbox 360 as well as PS3, and the whole Kingdom Hearts franchise recently repeated this feat. The excitement for Final Fantasy 16 is enhanced even further by it being a surprise shadow drop, and at this point, it's safe to say that it won't be the last that Xbox fans see.

Final Fantasy 16 Is The Latest In A Line of Shadow Drops

Shadow Drops Form An Increasing Portion Of Xbox’s Output

While every major game publisher has been known to surprise their fans once in a while, Xbox in particular has noticeably shifted towards surprise game releases since the beginning of 2023. Tango Gameworks' Hi-Fi Rush was the first success Xbox saw from this practice back in the January 2023 Developer_Direct, even if Hi-Fi Rush has since left Xbox’s umbrella, and the trend has only picked up steam since. Currently, the list of recent Xbox-affiliated shadow drops includes:

  • Hi-Fi Rush - January 2023 Developer_Direct
  • Animal Well - October 2024 Xbox Partner Preview
  • Blindfire - October 2024 Xbox Partner Preview
  • Death Stranding Director’s Cut - November 2024
  • Ninja Gaiden 2 Black - January 2025 Developer_Direct
  • The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion - April 2025
  • Final Fantasy 16 - June 2025 Xbox Games Showcase

In the year leading up to the 2025 Xbox Games Showcase, Xbox showed an increasing willingness to drop both ports and new game releases onto players, and sometimes, these didn't even need to coincide with larger Xbox events. A remaster of The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion is a huge deal for Xbox and Bethesda fans, and its abrupt launch didn't diminish its success, so between it and the other notable titles released that way, like Ninja Gaiden 2 Black , it's likely that Xbox shadow-drops are here to stay.

Xbox Should Keep Shadow-Dropping Games Like Final Fantasy 16

In general, shadow drops seem to be working out well for Xbox. Although marketing games has obvious benefits, it's become noticeably more difficult in recent years for games to be seen online and elsewhere, so a good shadow drop can still generate the excitement that a strong announcement would otherwise have. Shadow drops are also a good dispersal method for high-profile indie and AA titles, something that Xbox representatives have stated they would like more of in their lineup.

Game Pass Shadow Drops Are Also Good For Xbox

One last benefit of normalizing shadow drops is that Xbox already uses them frequently, but not for full game launches. Although shadow dropping something normally means releasing it alongside its announcement, new Xbox Game Pass arrivals have also been called shadow drops by official Xbox marketing. Because Game Pass is vital for Xbox’s success, establishing this practice should ensure that people frequently discuss new Game Pass releases and theorize about what could join it next. Final Fantasy 16 may not represent anything new for Xbox, but it does prove that Xbox knows how to leverage the element of surprise.

item.title: How To Get Carbon Ore In Dune: Awakening
item.description:
After previously mining Granite Stone, Copper Ore, and Iron Ore, the next step of progression in Dune: Awakening is to find and mine Carbon Ore , with this being one of the materials required to produce Steel Ingots .

How To Mine Carbon Ore In Dune: Awakening

Before players set off to mine Carbon Ore, there are a few things they will need .

A Powerful Enough Mining Tool

As players progress through the game, they will encounter harder ores that require more powerful mining tools to be cracked. For Carbon Ore, players will need a Cutteray Mk2 . Beyond Carbon, it is also capable of mining Erythrite Crystals.

A Cutteray Mk2 is produced via a General Frabricator and requires the following components:

  • 10 Iron Ingots
  • 7 EMF Generators

More powerful mining tools are also more efficient, mining larger yields. Some Planetologist Skills also help with this.

A Sandbike With Storage

As players are likely to face a fair journey , with them possibly traveling from a base in the Vermillius Gap, they will need a Sandbike. Furthermore, as lots of Carbon Ore will be needed , it's best to upgrade the Sandbike with storage , allowing them to transport way more Ore and other loot.

Consider a Sandbike Inventory Mk2 if possible, for even more storage.

Carbon Ore Location In Dune: Awakening

Carbon Ore in Dune: Awakening is all found in one region, Jabal Eifrit Al-Janub . Once players arrive here, they should see it everywhere, with the appearance of white crystals coming out of a brown rock .

For those who haven't discovered Jabal Eifrit Al-Janub yet , it is north of the Eastern Vermillius Gap, west of Hagga Rift, and east of the northern part of the Western Vermillius Gap.

When raiding camps in this area and other nearby ones, players will often find Carbon Ore as loot .

With Jabal Eifrit Al-Janub being bordered by dangerous drumsand and quicksand to the west and south, an easier way to reach it is to head east from the Eastern Vermillius Gap into Hagga Rift and drive up .

Braver players can try to find gaps between the drumsand though, and reach the Carbon Ore location faster. Lastly, be aware that every Tuesday, there is a Coriolis Storm , which mostly affects the Deep Desert, but also randomizes the exact location of resources . Carbon Ore will still be found in the same general location , but not in the exact same places.

What Is Carbon Ore Used For In Dune: Awakening?

Carbon Ore is the main ingredient for crafting Steel Ingots in Dune: Awakening , with Steel being crucial for the mid-game. Steel Ingots are produced at a Small Ore Refinery using the following materials:

  • 4 Carbon Ore
  • 1 Iron Ingot
  • 50 Water

This will produce a single Steel Ingot , hammering home the message that lots of Carbon Ore is needed. As plenty of water will be used too for this process and others, make sure to be aware of the best methods for gathering and storing large quantities of water.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3 Fan Shows Off Mizora Cosplay, Complete With Wings
item.description:
A talented Baldur's Gate 3 fan online has showcased their impressive Mizora cosplay, which even comes complete with her wings as seen in-game. The Baldur's Gate 3 fan looks just like the popular character, who remains a bit of a fan favorite despite her limited screen time.

Since the release of Baldur's Gate 3 , fans have been sharing their unique creations and tributes to the game in whatever way they see fit. Cosplay is a big part of this, with fans choosing to recreate the outfits of and dress up as their favorite characters from the game. Some even put their own spins on the character, such as the Baldur's Gate 3 fan who showed off their female Raphael cosplay. Because Baldur's Gate 3 has such a varied and distinctive cast of characters, there is enormous potential for cosplay from the game.

Redditor Frau_Haku shared their impressive Baldur's Gate 3 Mizora cosplay with the game's community online, in a series of images with the background edited to look like they have been pulled directly from the game. If anything, it only highlights how accurate the cosplay is to its game equivalent. Perhaps most impressive of all is the final image, which reveals that pre-edits, the wings on the cosplay are actually real and every bit as detailed as they look.

This Baldur's Gate 3 Mizora Cosplay Comes Complete With Wings

Frau_Haku is one of the most prominent cosplayers in the Baldur's Gate 3 community, having created various different characters from the game. In the past, they have also created an impressive Lae'zel Baldur's Gate 3 cosplay, which is arguably every bit as great as this Mizora piece. Let's hope they continue to share creative cosplay like this for some time to come.

Despite the big success of Baldur's Gate 3 almost two years ago, the franchise's future is unclear. With Larian now fully moved on from the property, there could be a long wait for Baldur's Gate 4 as Wizards of the Coast finds a new direction for the franchise. It's going to be a lofty task for any new developer to live up to the hype created by Baldur's Gate 3 , so it would almost be better for the eventual developer to take its time and do things right.

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 6 May Be Taking San Andreas’ Wackiest Mechanic to New Heights
item.description:
Another round of Grand Theft Auto 6 leaks has hit the internet, and they make some bold claims about the game's features and mechanics. The wait for Grand Theft Auto 6 has been filled with leaks and rumors, and while such claims should always be met with heavy skepticism, these features are compelling, if true.

This series of leaks comes from Twitter user GameRoll, the person who leaked the full names of Lucia and Jason before they were revealed. If GameRoll's information is correct, GTA 6 could have a limited weapon wheel and potentially over 700 stores for players to explore. Until Rockstar confirms such features, these claims are purely rumors, but one detail mentioned in the leaks could be signaling a callback to San Andreas : weight mechanics.

According to Leaks, GTA 6 Could Mark the Return of San Andreas' Weight System

A Fresh Weight System Would Bring Roleplaying to New Heights

If true, the return of San Andreas ' weight mechanics would be an exciting addition to a game that already seems to be packed with content and features. San Andreas ' weight system makes it a unique entry in the franchise. This feature also proved to be quite popular in fellow Rockstar game Red Dead Redemption 2 , so it would make sense for GTA 6 's developers to bring it back. The GTA 6 leaks could give players higher expectations, but bringing back the weight system definitely isn't outside the realm of possibility.

The map locations confirmed to be in GTA 6 are Vice City, the Leonida Keys, the Grassrivers, Port Gellhorn, Ambrosia, and Mount Kalaga.

GTA 6's Weight System Wouldn't Have to Work Hard to Be Even Better

Between San Andreas and Red Dead Redemption 2 , Rockstar doesn't exactly have to make any major improvements to the past weight systems. Just with the game's improved graphics alone, recycling the old system with more realistic visuals would be enough to make in-game weight gain and loss feel fresh. There are high hopes for GTA 6 to bring its realism to the next level, and a more in-depth weight system could do just that.

If Rockstar has built a more detailed version of San Andreas ' weight mechanics, then it will be fascinating to see just how much of an improvement has been made. In the second trailer, it has already been teased that weightlifting could play a role in the game. Jason is seen lifting weights on the beach, and this might be hinting at the return of a weight system. The changes San Andreas ' weight mechanics make to CJ's abilities added a special layer of depth to its gameplay, and with GTA 6 teasing one of the franchise's most in-depth games yet, there's no telling what a fresh take on the system could be like.

GTA 6 is slated to launch on May 26, 2026.

Other Features Claimed to Be in GTA 6

  • The ability to switch between protagonists Jason and Lucia
  • A weapon wheel inspired by RDR2
  • Underwater areas that can be explored
  • Six-star "Wanted" level
  • The option to "Greet" or "Antagonize" NPCs

Only time will tell if these new GTA 6 leaks are accurate, but they are indeed intriguing. There are a lot of features that would make GTA 6 a great experience, and weight mechanics would really be beneficial for players who truly appreciate realism.

While there is still a lot of mystery surrounding GTA 6 , it's at least certain that the game is set to be a massive launch. With a release date locked in, GTA 6 is now less than a year away. It's been a long journey, and as the year continues, it will be interesting to see if Rockstar confirms or debunks any of these rumored features.

item.title: Final Fantasy: 8 Games With The Biggest Worlds
item.description:
Summary

  • Many Final Fantasy games feature massive worlds, with Final Fantasy 14 possibly having the biggest world in the series.
  • Titles like Final Fantasy 4, 5, and 6 offer memorable overworlds and dimensions for players to explore.
  • Final Fantasy games like 8 and 9 have engaging secrets hidden in their overworlds, creating memorable experiences for players.

Final Fantasy is one of the most popular video game franchises around. Despite having its fair share of ups and downs, countless JRPG fans can't get enough of the many legendary titles in this series that boast memorable characters, engaging stories, fun combat, and massive worlds.

Final Fantasy has experimented with various world structures, ranging from classic overworlds to linear levels and everything in between. Some worlds in the Final Fantasy games have a great sense of scale and ensure that players will be wowed by their size. Out of them all, however, these Final Fantasy games arguably feature the biggest worlds of them all.

8 Final Fantasy 4

Players Explore Multiple Overworlds, Including One On The Moon Itself

6 Images
6 Images
Final Fantasy 4
7.0 /10
Released
July 19, 1991

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Final Fantasy 4 's story-driven approach ensured that even the classic jobs of this title would play a role in the epic narrative. It helps that the game has several overworlds for players to find, with Earth itself having an Underground section that is more expansive than most fans would assume.

Near the end of the story, players will also land on the mood to take out Zemus, the Lunarian who has been pulling the strings behind the scenes. This allows players to explore a new overworld map, further enhancing the sense of scale and exploration in the game.

7 Final Fantasy 6

Both The World Of Balance And World Of Ruin Are Tantalizing To Explore

Final Fantasy 6
12
9.1 /10
Released
October 11, 1994

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Fantasy Violence, Partial Nudity
Powered by

Final Fantasy 6 is legendary for boasting some of the most memorable overworlds in JRPG history. The World of Balance is a place that players will explore in a fairly linear fashion, barring a few moments when the party splits up and multiple narratives are experienced concurrently.

However, after Kefka brings ruin to the world, players are given control of Celes in a brand-new overworld where progression is totally non-linear. This makes for a great second half of the game and ensures that the massive overworlds of Final Fantasy 6 will leave a lasting impression on players.

6 Final Fantasy 15

The First Open-World Final Fantasy Game Doesn't Disappoint In Terms Of Scale

Final Fantasy 15
9 /10
8.2 /10
Released
November 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Language, Mild Blood, Partial Nudity, Violence
Powered by

The first open-world Final Fantasy game had a rocky launch, but most fans agree that the final product is well worth checking out, especially with the advent of the Royal and Windows Editions . The base game boasted a massive open world that feels grander in scale with these enhanced releases.

Controlling a boat that lets players reach Altissia is a simple way to enhance the scale of the world, and expanding on Insomnia near the tail end of the game was a genius move to ensure that players could witness the destruction of the city firsthand before taking on Ardyn in one final battle.

5 Final Fantasy 14

This MMO Has Expanded So Much Over Time That It Boasts Possibly The Biggest World In The Series

Final Fantasy 14
14
8.9 /10
Released
August 27, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen - Language, Mild Blood, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Powered by

As one of the greatest MMOs ever made, it's easy to see why Final Fantasy 14 boasts one of the biggest worlds in the series. The base game itself had a large map, and it has slowly expanded in size with numerous expansions.

As things stand, most fans would agree that Final Fantasy 14 's world is the biggest there has ever been in a Final Fantasy game. The numerous zones and locations present in the current version of this MMO are mind-boggling and let players enjoy hundreds of hours of content just by exploring alone.

4 Final Fantasy 5

Players Explore Two Overworlds That Eventually Merge During The Game's Final Act

Final Fantasy 5
8.6 /10
Released
December 6, 1992

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Mild Fantasy Violence, Partial Nudity
Powered by

Final Fantasy 5 's regular overworld is notable enough as is, which is why fans will be pleasantly surprised when they travel to Galuf's dimension and see that there's another overworld for them to explore. However, things don't stop here.

After a series of events causes both worlds to merge and form one single entity, players will have access to a third overworld to explore. To make things even better, players can acquire a submarine to explore the Sea Floor as well, which makes for yet another zone to enhance the scope of exploration.

3 Final Fantasy 7

Stepping Out Of Midgar Into The Overworld Makes For A Fantastic Moment

Final Fantasy 7
18
8.6 /10
Released
January 31, 1997

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Fantasy Violence, Language, Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Final Fantasy 7 's first few hours take place in the sprawling city of Midgar, which is absolutely massive. It's a brilliant sequence that slowly eases players into the game before they can finally explore the overworld following the assault on Shinra Headquarters.

This makes the player's first steps in this massive overworld all the more magical. Just like Final Fantasy 5 , players can also use a submarine to explore the sea floor, although they should give Emerald Weapon a wide berth while exploring if they don't want to face a premature Game Over.

2 Final Fantasy 8

A Cool Overworld Full Of Engaging Secrets To Find

Final Fantasy 8
12
9.8 /10
Released
February 11, 1999

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Final Fantasy 8 took a while to slowly win over fans, with its odd Junction system and weird story becoming endearing in its own way. However, one aspect of the game that received universal praise was its exploration.

From the massive halls of Balamb Garden to the many cities players explore during their travels, the world of Final Fantasy 8 certainly feels big. Countless players will love flying both Balamb Garden and the Ragnarok in this world as they search for secrets and acquire the services of optional Guardian Forces.

1 Final Fantasy 9

The World Of Gaia Is Massive And Embodies The Best Of Final Fantasy

Final Fantasy 9
17
9.5 /10
Released
July 7, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Violence, Mild Language
Powered by

The world of Gaia in Final Fantasy 9 is beautiful and full of unique locations to find. Even the Chocobo Hot & Cold side quest gives players another reason to explore the overworld, although it can be a bit irritating to make progress in this quest chain at times.

Regardless, the overworld is yet another reason why fans love Final Fantasy 9 to death. It may not be as massive as some of the other games in the series, but it still boasts an impressive scope that deserves a mention.
